review_text:
The studio space is a nice spot to come into after a day of travel and sightseeing. The pretty blue door, small private front patio area and driveway parking at the rear are very handy to get in and out of the unit. It was quiet and peaceful.
The unit is attached to the back of a private home, but is itâ€™s own space with private, keypad entry. The hosts are responsive but respectful of privacy.
The kitchenette is just the right size with a two seater table, a well stocked coffee bar (thanks!), small fridge and microwave.
The queen bed and linens are comfortable and nice as are the bath linens. The shower has body wash, shampoo and conditioner as well as a hair dryer.
The location made it easy for us to head out the next morning towards Del Rio. We would stay again if in the area.

review_text: Location is ideal. Right next to The San Antonio Museum of Art. Exit the building and you're right on the river. Walk either direction and there's everything you're looking for. There wasn't any furniture on the balcony, it wasn't listed it in the description, but you don't need it. Head down the hallway to the rooftop deck and you have views of the river and great sitting areas. There is an EV charging station right behind the parking space but Ritchie didn't know how to use it and it took a while to get the card that you need to operate it. I ended up just using the supercharger stations outside the city instead. Communication with Ritchie was quick except for the EV charging card. Everything was nice in the unit but could have used sharper cutting knives, a peeler, some scissors and some food storage containers. Everything else is there to cook with. Check out was simple and the app used to move throughout the building was easy to use. I would definitely recommend staying here.

I will list the pros and cons of our stay at this accommodation:
Cons:
-We got in late our first night and did not have any sheets for the pull out bed. The next afternoon sheets were delivered to our doorstep but they were unwashed (new) and the wrong size so we had to waste some time washing and drying them prior to use.
-Garbage can did not have a liner when we arrived.
-You have to use an app on your phone as a hotel key of sorts. It gets you into the parking garage and other places around the accommodation. Unfortunately, at least one gate would not open this way (saying the gate needed to be â€œupdatedâ€) so it was kind of a hassle.
-On our second to last day, a car parked in our assigned spot and didnâ€™t move for the rest of our stay.
-While the accommodation is on the river walk, it is a pretty lengthy walk to the main part of the river walk.
Pros:
-Relatively quick response from host.
-On the river (though a ways from the main river walk area).
-A/C and W/D

review_text: Attending a conference for the week and all of the walkable hotels were too expensive and if given the option I would rather something away from the hustle and bustle. What stood out about this location was the access to Riverwalk and all the great restaurants and activities. Additionally, I liked that the property had quiet time so you could actually get sleep and rest. It is hard for me to rest in a hotel because of the noise. All the issues were not Pete and Katrina's fault as they maintain a very nice apartment. But just be aware before you expect to use the "amenities".

The beds and linens and towels were all very nice.
It would have been nice to have a table and chairs on the fabulous balcony. Just standing out there lost all appeal pretty quickly. And picking up the fob to get into the building was a bit quirky, but we managed it.
Having said that, I would totally book this space again.

I don't have anything negative to say about this home. It's close to everything- Downtown, Riverwalk, The Pearl, The Japanese Tea Garden all are just minutes away with Uber. I'd stay here again if I'm ever in San Antonio again.

Area: I thought this place was in the middle of nowhere and no one around so I was a bit nervous as a female but there were several well established homes in the area without taking away from the sense of space and being in the country so I felt much safer without feeling like I'm being monitored lol
Inside: it was as photographed. clean and cute. not fancy but very homey. There is a TV where you can watch Netflix and few other streaming services. if you like fluffier and or firmer pillows, I'd bring your own. nothing wrong with them but may not be for everyone. the shower was warm and had good pressure. there's basic kitchen items so we were able to save some money and cook for ourselves in between if we needed to.
Our Hosts: they were very kind and welcoming. they were attentive without being overwhelming. if you message them, they respond in adequate time!

name: Sam
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
April 2023
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text: What a Lovely stay! This tiny home was a wonderful get away for my husband and I for our anniversary! The home was easy to find, easy to get into, and had a host that was fast with their responses! We had a rollercoaster of weather, thankfully they had a window AC that cooled the home completely and heaters that heated the space rather quickly! There is a fridge and a microwave (good for those leftovers) and a stove and pots that were very handy! BE CAREFUL that you don't flush toilet paper!!! I had to fish it out a couple of times due to habit. I highly recommend bringing a travel bidet- it works wonders! You do share a space (grill, campfire, patio, and table) with the RV next door, always fun getting to know new people! It's only about 30 minutes out from San Antonio but only 10 from the nearest HEB and some fast food options. It's secluded but still near everything! We had an amazing stay and are so excited to go back some day! Highly recommend this BNB!

review_text: Really nice little place way out. Rafael responded quickly to questions and his instructions for check-in were very good. Please be sure to make note of not flushing toilet paper. Thankfully there's a handy sign by the toilet to remind you. It's a reflex... My review would be five stars but for a couple of things, like a bathroom door that likes to open itself. I've been married for 37 years, but I still like to go in private. And it's impossible to close it quietly enough to not wake the wife. The only other thing is the TV that must have known that we weren't there to watch TV anyway. If we ever need a place way out on the west side of San Antonio in the future we would consider booking again.

With a surprisingly comfy futon. we didnâ€™t even pull out the bed, It was comfy enough as a sofa. The neighbors are near, but you wouldnâ€™t even know it. Do yourself a favor a book a stay here if you and your partner are looking to stay in San Antonio. Great option. all you need. super cute and quaint. Stayed a few nights
review_text: Rafael's tiny home is a great price and comfortable, with both cold air, Ceiling fan, and heat. His directions were perfect and he provided a code to the box as well as a remote for the gate to ease coming and going. FYI - There are no stores of any kind close by to this place, so make sure you bring your snacks and water with you, as there is a refrigerator but no bottled water or snacks provided. Also bring your own shampoo and conditioner. We thought it was a great price for the stay. Very quiet and relaxing. The other thing to consider is that there are NO lights on the roads leading to the house. We typically arrive in the evenings as we are visiting family in SA. If you are over 40 or have bad eyesight-arrive before dark! It is extremely difficult to see at night.

The Dias de las Muertas parade and celebrations were great fun. We spent Halloween evening on King Williams handing out candy at the house of someone we just met that afternoon. People in SA are very friendly and helpful.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This darling, modern little house was perfect for two women and a teen on a girlsâ€™ weekend. *Ideal location 8 minutes from the Alamodome*, and close to great neighborhood restaurants for those like me who do not want to pay for parking and tourist menus on the Riverwalk. Photos are accurate - in fact, it felt bigger than expected! Ample parking, a picket fence encloses a small grass yard, inviting porch; inside is a full kitchen, good sized living room, huge shower in the full bathroom, and a very comfortable queen bed in the loft. The neighborhood has many well-worn homes with a sprinkle of new homes popping up - this small house is tucked behind a large newer corner house, which adds a feeling of comfort and security. Renata communicated well and made us feel at home. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, hope to stay again, and strongly recommend this Air B&B!

review_text: Lauren's AirBnB is Awesome! Lauren is like the ninja of hosts â€“ super responsive and on the ball with every question we threw her way. It's like she's got this sixth sense for what you need before you even know you need it. The place is snug as a bug, super cozy, and just oozes homey vibes. Every nook and cranny is just where it should be, making the most of the space. And if you're worried about parking, don't be. It's a breezy walk away â€“ less than 10 minutes, and you're parked and ready to explore. So, would I stay here again? In a heartbeat! Would I recommend it to you? Absolutely, So go ahead, book Lauren's place and thank me later. Thank you Lauren for everything!

Overall, this rental is clean, comfortable, and close to everything downtown. The Riverwalk was a short walk away, as was The Alamo.
Pros:
- Close to everything downtown
- Extremely clean and welcoming
- Mostly quiet building
- Easy to check in/out
- Lauren is kind and very responsive
Cons:
- There is a lot of â€œdecorâ€ that impedes space. I would not recommend more than 2 people rent this at a time. We were moving stuff around just to walk through the apartment.
- As the description says, maintenance can happen during your stay. However, we didnâ€™t expect the strong smell of paint fumes to overtake the bathroom for hours. It was almost unusable due to the smell.
For the price, weâ€™re not sure itâ€™s 100% worth it. But, we did enjoy our stay and it worked for what we needed. Lauren was also very responsive and kind when we asked about check in.

Huge bathroom with tub/shower; mind step up to enter BR & tub contour. Great set up for kitchen & coffee/tea bar! MANY thoughtful amenities provided!
Box fan provided was very helpful for noise cancellation for sleeping if needed.
GREAT find! Would return in a heartbeat next visit to SA!

Stayed about a week
review_text:
My daughter and I stayed at Taylor and Hunter's casita for a week. We loved the neighborhood. It was quiet, walkable, great restaurants nearby & easy to access major highways. We walked the neighborhood to enjoy the architecture of the homes, the landscaping, ~100 year old live oak trees and festive lights. It was magnificent. We also visited a nearby park and the Japanese tea garden. The hosts provided a guest guide that was extremely helpful in choosing restaurants and activities.
Cappy's restaurant was within walking distance and had fantastic patio seating. Cappy's became our neighborhood hangout.
The Bird Cafe is also excellent. We had breakfast there and purchased sandwiches to go for our flight.
Central Market was also within walking distance. We had never experienced anything like it. Just shopping in their produce section is a unique experience.
Taylor and Hunter were also very responsive to any questions we had during our stay.
We highly recommend staying here.

The location was great, as it is right in the middle of the city. It was a 5 minute drive to some of San Antonioâ€™s best attractions- the Pearl, Doseum, Riverwalk and zoo! The walkability of the casita allowed us to visit the grocery, restaurants and parks without even getting in our car, and the neighborhood was absolutely beautiful.
